#### Edit Configuration

In the \TM40-PXY directory edit the *web.config* file using the notepad editor

![](/Image/install08.png)

1.  Change the line:
    
    ```<action type="Rewrite" value="http{R:1}://tmstg02-beta.teammentor.net/{R:2}" />``` 
    
    Replacing *tmstg02-beta.teammentor.net* with the URL  of your site. For example *www.teammentor.net*
    
2. Change the lines for custom errors.
    
    Replacing *tmstg02-beta.teammentor.net* with the URL for your site. Make sure to leave the last /error as is and only change the first part of the URL. For example replace with *www.teammentor.net* . 
    
    This is with the exception of the line.  
    
    ``` <error statusCode="403" subStatusCode="4" path="https://tmstg02-beta.teammentor.net" responseMode="Redirect" />```
    
     This should have no */error* at the end. 
     
3. Change the default error to the correct URL.

     ```<customErrors mode="RemoteOnly" defaultRedirect="https://tmstg02-beta.teammentor.net/error" />```

#### Configure IIS Site.
- Open IIS and choose to “Add Site”
- Give the site a name. Point the physical path to the TM40-PXY directory. 
- Enter the hostname of your TM40 site. This will be the URL most users will be accessing at all times.

![](/Image/install09.png)

Edit bindings and add the SSL version of the site.


#### Force SSL
- In the Proxy site you’ve just configured open SSL Settings
- Click on “Require SSL”

![](/Image/install10.png)

#### Enable URL Rewrite
- In the server node configuration, select Application Request Routing
- Select “Server Proxy Settings” On the right hand side
- Click “Enable Proxy” 

![](/Image/install11.png)
